intro: Tapura ivorensis, commonly known as the Ivory Coast tapura, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
